root.geography: Spoken in Nootka Sound, extending from the mouth of the Salmon River to the south of the Columbia River

child.geography: Spoken chiefly in the west fo Vancouver Island, as far north as Cape Hook

child.geography: Spoken on the west side of King's Island and Cascade Inlet

root.publications: Powell, J. W. 1891. Indian Linguistic Families of America North of Mexico, 1-142. Washington D.C.: Government Printing Office.
root.pub-comments: From Waukash, the Nootka word for "good". The two vocabularies of the subgroups within the family are distinct (but enough words are common to show relation), and are unrelated to other familes. Speakers: 3617
